marketNews.title: MSCI: Barito Renewables Energy, Petrindo Jaya Kreasi, and Petrosea Not Included in May 2025 Review
marketNews.content: MSCI on Friday (April 11) announced that Barito Renewables Energy (BREN), Petrindo Jaya Kreasi (CUAN), and Petrosea (PTRO) will remain excluded from the inclusion list in the May 2025 index review. The announcement is an update after MSCI opened a consultation period for market participants and investors regarding the investability of the three stocks. Previously, MSCI had decided that BREN, CUAN, and PTRO would not be added to the MSCI Indonesia Investable Market Index in the February 2025 review due to potential investability constraints. In the Friday announcement, MSCI also explained that it is examining the addition of a rule whereby stocks listed on the IDX that have been subject to an Unusual Market Activity (UMA) announcement or placed on a monitoring board within the past 12 months because of abnormal price movements would not be considered for inclusion in the MSCI Global Investable Market Indexes. MSCI will accept input on the rule change until June 20, 2025, with an update to be released on July 11, 2025. For reference, the last dates that BREN, CUAN, and PTRO received a UMA or were placed on a monitoring board are: BREN – June 20, 2024 (last trading day on a special monitoring board); CUAN – January 8, 2025 (UMA); PTRO – September 4, 2024 (UMA). Following MSCI's announcement, the closing prices on Monday (April 14) were up +9.71% for BREN, +7.5% for CUAN, and +4% for PTRO. The precedent set by these three stocks, together with the potential new rule on UMA and special monitoring boards, could make it more difficult for a stock to qualify for inclusion in MSCI Global Investable Market Indexes. If implemented, the rule would increase regulator influence – specifically the IDX – in determining a stock's eligibility for MSCI indices.

marketNews.title: ERAA: Share Buyback Up to Rp50 Billion
marketNews.content: ERAA: Erajaya Swasembada plans a share buyback with a funding allocation of up to 50 billion rupiah from April 14 to July 13, 2025. The company did not disclose the maximum number of shares that will be repurchased. The plan does not require shareholder approval, following the relaxation granted by the OJK to support market stability. PGAS: Perusahaan Gas Negara announced that the gas purchase agreement with West Natuna Energy Ltd. in the Duyung Block was terminated on April 12, 2025. The termination reduces PGAS's gas supply projection by 122.77 TBTU. OASA: The President Director of Maharaksa Biru Energi, Bobby Gafur Umar, said the company will build a waste-to-energy power plant (PLTSa) valued at 2.6 trillion rupiah in Cipeucang, South Tangerang. The PLTSa will be built through a consortium owned by OASA's subsidiary PT Indoplas Energi Hijau and China Tianying Inc., with PT Indoplas Energi Hijau acting as the consortium leader. The plant is targeted to start operations in 2028 with a generation capacity of 25 MW, of which about 5 MW will be used internally and about 20 MW will be sold to PLN. TBLA: Tunas Baru Lampung plans a buyback of up to 300 million shares (4.97% of outstanding) with a funding allocation of up to 200 billion rupiah from April 14 to July 13, 2025. The plan does not require shareholder approval, following the OJK's relaxation to support market stability. LTLS: Lautan Luas, through its subsidiary PT Lautan Air Indonesia, announced that it has purchased a 21% stake in its own subsidiary PT Lautan Organo Water for 16.3 billion rupiah from Organo Corporation. After the transaction, LTLS indirectly becomes the controlling shareholder of PT Lautan Organo Water. HILL: The controlling shareholder of Hillcon, PT Hillcon Equity Management, sold 27.5 million HILL shares at 360 rupiah per share on April 8, 2025. The total transaction value was approximately 9.9 billion rupiah. After the sale, PT Hillcon Equity Management's ownership in HILL decreased from 57.72% to 57.54%. FUTR: Shareholder of Futura Energi Global, Vincent le Kok Hui, purchased about 64.9 million FUTR shares at 77 rupiah per share on April 10, 2025. The total transaction value was about 5 billion rupiah. After the purchase, Vincent's ownership in FUTR increased from 4.26% to 5.24%. RAJA: Two board members of Rukun Raharja, Djauhar Maulidi and Ogi Rulino, each bought 150,000 and 200,000 RAJA shares at 1,810 rupiah and 1,665 rupiah per share on March 27, 2025 and April 8, 2025 respectively. The transaction values were approximately 272 million rupiah and 333 million rupiah. After the purchases, their holdings rose, but remained around 0.001% and 0.0005% of total shares.

marketNews.title: US President Donald Trump says tariffs on smartphones and electronics will remain
marketNews.content: US President Donald Trump said on Sunday (April 13) that he will continue to impose tariffs on imports of smartphones, computers, and other popular electronic goods. The clarification came after those items were exempted from reciprocal tariffs over the weekend. Trump also signaled that details on tariffs for semiconductor commodities will be announced later this week.

marketNews.title: Indonesia proposes to import $18-19 billion US goods in tariff negotiations
marketNews.content: The Secretary of the Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs, Susiwijono Moegiarso, said that the Indonesian government proposes to import US goods worth about 18-19 billion US dollars as part of a tariff negotiation proposal with the United States. The proposal aims to offset the US trade deficit with Indonesia, which in 2024 was recorded at 16.8 billion US dollars. Additionally, the Deputy Minister of Investment and Inward Investment, Todotua Pasaribu, mentioned that the proposal also suggests that Indonesian state-owned enterprises invest in the US oil, gas, and information technology sectors.

marketNews.title: BPI Danantara CIO Pandu Sjahrir ready to be liquidity provider in Indonesian capital market
marketNews.content: Chief Investment Officer of BPI Danantara, Pandu Sjahrir, said on Monday (April 14) that the firm is ready to become a liquidity provider in the Indonesian capital market. The statement came after the Chairman of the OJK Board of Commissioners, Mahendra Siregar, said on Friday (April 11) that the regulator had coordinated with BPI Danantara to encourage government-owned financial institutions to increase their investments in the capital market as institutional investors. Pandu noted that BPI Danantara is reviewing plans to allocate dividend cash received at the end of April 2025 for further investment.

marketNews.title: China customs reports 6.4% YoY decline in coal imports to 38.73 million tons in March 2025
marketNews.content: China's customs administration reported that coal imports fell 6.4% year-on-year to 38.73 million tons in March 2025. The drop was driven by high stock levels at ports and weak domestic demand, which pushed spot prices to a four-year low. This marks the first annual decline in Chinese coal imports since March 2022, excluding the January-February period when year-on-year comparisons were affected by the Chinese New Year holiday.

marketNews.title: AISI reports domestic motorcycle sales 541,684 units in March 2025, down 7.2% YoY
marketNews.content: The Indonesian Motorcycle Industry Association (AISI) reported that domestic motorcycle sales reached 541,684 units in March 2025, a decline of 7.2% year-on-year and 6.8% month-on-month. The result brings total motorcycle sales for the first three months of 2025 to approximately 1.7 million units, down 3% year-on-year, representing 25-26% of AISI's 2025 target of 6.4-6.7 million units.

marketNews.title: President Prabowo says Qatar commits $2 billion to joint fund for BPI Danantara
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto claimed on Sunday (April 13) that Qatar has committed to invest US$2 billion in a joint fund for BPI Danantara.

marketNews.title: Goldman Sachs raises 2025 gold price target to $3,700 per ounce
marketNews.content: Goldman Sachs lifted its 2025 gold price target to US$3,700 per troy ounce, driven by heightened concerns over the US economy amid an escalating trade war with China. This upgrade marks the third gold outlook revision by Goldman Sachs this year, following a March 2025 increase to US$3,300 per ounce. The bank also warned that in an extreme-risk scenario, gold could reach US$4,500 per ounce by the end of 2025.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia reports foreign reserves rise to $157.1 billion at end of March 2025
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia reported that Indonesia's foreign exchange reserves rose to US$157.1 billion at the end of March 2025, up from US$154.5 billion in February 2025. The reserves now cover about 6.7 months of import financing or 6.5 months of import financing plus external debt service. The increase was driven by higher tax and service revenues as well as foreign loan drawdowns, amid policies aimed at stabilising the rupiah exchange rate.

marketNews.title: Pertamina Geothermal Energy signs joint study agreement with Turkey's Zorlu Enerji
marketNews.content: Pertamina Geothermal Energy (PGEO) signed a joint study agreement with Turkey's Zorlu Enerji Elektrik Uretim A.S. to explore cooperation on a geothermal power plant project within Zorlu Enerji's licensed geothermal area in Turkey.
